text: Chionodes bicostomaculella is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from Vermont and Michigan to Florida and Texas.Chionodes at funetmothphotographersgroup The forewings are blackish, or very dark brown, intermixed with ochreous and grey and with a small and indistinct ochreous spot on the costa near the base, and another distinct costalous at the beginning of the cilia, and an opposite dorsal one. There are several rather undefined irregular blackish spots or patches on the wings, which appear to form three irregular transverse bands, not very definite in outline, one of which adjoins each of the costal ochreous spots, while the other is between them.Can. Ent. 4 (7): 127 The larvae feed on Quercus species. ==References== Category:Chionodes Category:Moths described in 1872 Category:Moths of North America
title: Chionodes bicostomaculella
